description:
My attempt to capture a RARE "perfect" lunar transit of the International Space Station .... I'm  so glad I managed to capture it, but I regret to not have a most suitable equipment!

Imaged with my 8" Dobson , without any GOTO or EQ platform, and Sony a7s + 2X Barlow lens

UPDATE 1/21/2020

THANK YOU all for the unexpected POD nomination! Further details about this shoot: I made it @ 4:51 AM, I woke up 2hrs before and drove (oh, well... Actuallu my car drove me, I was a little asleep) for about 40' to the pre-defined location. I set up my Meade Lightbridge Dobson and my Sony a7s at prime focus (with a 2x barlow) and made a few test shoots.... 60fps FullHD video, 1/6400" (based on my pixel size and transit duration to avoid blurred frames) and 3200 ISO.

Here's the original clip:

https://youtu.be/mBRzQMHS_9k
title: ISS Transit 12-01-2020
